intro: Hieracium pullostylum, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, and they bloom in the summer months. Hieracium pullostylum is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
